2025-06-04.title: The Phoenician Scheme
2025-06-04.synopsis: The story of a family and a family business. Starring: Benicio del Toro as Zsa-zsa Korda, one of the richest men in Europe; Mia Threapleton as Liesl, his daughter/a nun; Michael Cera as Bjorn, their tutor. With: Riz Ahmed, Tom Hanks, Bryan Cranston, Mathieu Amalric, Richard Ayoade, Jeffrey Wright, Scarlett Johansson, Benedict Cumberbatch, Rupert Friend, Hope Davis.

2025-06-04.title: The Ballad of Wallis Island
2025-06-04.synopsis: Eccentric lottery winner Charles dreams of getting his favorite musicians, McGwyer Mortimer, back together. The fantasy becomes real when the bandmates and former lovers agree to play a private show at his home on Wallis Island. Old tensions resurface as Charles tries desperately to salvage his dream gig.

2025-06-04.title: Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning
2025-06-04.synopsis: Light the fuse because Tom Cruise's world-saving super spy Ethan Hunt is back to complete a mission for the ages alongside Simon Pegg, Ving Rhames and Hayley Atwell. This propulsive action-adventure demands to be seen on the big screen.

2025-06-04.title: Final Destination: Bloodlines
2025-06-04.synopsis: The newest chapter in New Line Cinema’s bloody successful franchise takes audiences back to the very beginning of Death’s twisted sense of justice. Plagued by a violent recurring nightmare, college student Stefanie heads home to track down the one person who might be able to break the cycle and save her family from the grisly demise that inevitably awaits them all.

2025-06-04.title: Sinners
2025-06-04.synopsis: Trying to leave their troubled lives behind, twin brothers (Jordan) return to their hometown to start again, only to discover that an even greater evil is waiting to welcome them back.

2025-06-04.title: Along Came Love
2025-06-04.synopsis: A hotel waitress Madeleine who is mother to a little boy, meets a rich student François. The relation between them becomes so intense, but over time it's evident that François is trying to escape by entangling Madeleine's destiny with his.

2025-06-04.title: Flow
2025-06-04.synopsis: When a flood of biblical proportions washes its home away, a solitary cat must seek refuge with a motley crew of animals (including a dog, a capybara, a lemur and a secretarybird), who gradually learn to get along in this endearing, Oscar-winning animation.

2025-06-04.title: Ocean With David Attenborough
2025-06-04.synopsis:
OCEAN WITH DAVID ATTENBOROUGH takes viewers on a breathtaking journey showing there is nowhere more vital for our survival, more full of life, wonder, or surprise, than the ocean.

The celebrated broadcaster and filmmaker reveals how his lifetime has coincided with the great age of ocean discovery. Through spectacular sequences featuring coral reefs, kelp forests and the open ocean, Attenborough shares why a healthy ocean keeps the entire planet stable and flourishing.

Stunning, immersive cinematography showcases the wonder of life under the seas and exposes the realities and challenges facing our ocean as never-before-seen, from destructive fishing techniques to mass coral reef bleaching. Yet the story is one of optimism, with Attenborough pointing to inspirational stories from around the world to deliver his greatest message: the ocean can recover to a glory beyond anything anyone alive has ever seen.

Screening in cinemas with theatrically exclusive footage.

2025-06-04.title: Lilo & Stitch
2025-06-04.synopsis: A live-action reimagining of Disney’s 2002 animated classic, “Lilo & Stitch” is the wildly funny and touching story of a lonely Hawaiian girl and the fugitive alien who helps to mend her broken family. Directed by Dean Fleischer Camp, the Oscar®-nominated filmmaker behind the animated feature film “Marcel the Shell with Shoes On,” the film stars Sydney Elizebeth Agudong, Billy Magnussen, Tia Carrere, Hannah Waddingham, Chris Sanders, with Courtney B. Vance, and Zach Galifianakis, introducing Maia Kealoha. “Lilo & Stitch” is produced by Jonathan Eirich, p.g.a. and Dan Lin, with Louie Provost, Tom Peitzman and Ryan Halprin serving as executive producers.

2025-06-04.title: The Salt Path
2025-06-04.synopsis: THE SALT PATH is the profound true story of husband and wife, Raynor and Moth Winn’s 630-mile trek along the beautiful but rugged Cornish, Devon and Dorset coastline. After being forcibly removed from their home, they make the desperate decision to walk in the hope that, in nature, they will find solace and a sense of acceptance. With depleted resources, only a tent and some essentials between them, every step along the path is a testament to their growing strength and determination. THE SALT PATH is a journey that is exhilarating, challenging, and liberating in equal measure. A portrayal of home, how it can be lost and rediscovered in the most unexpected ways.

2025-06-04.title: Orlando
2025-06-04.synopsis: In 1600, nobleman Orlando (Tilda Swinton) inherits his parents' house, thanks to Queen Elizabeth I (Quentin Crisp), who commands the young man to never change. After a disastrous affair with Russian princess Sasha (Charlotte Valandrey), Orlando looks for solace in the arts before being appointed ambassador to Constantinople in 1700, where war is raging. One morning, Orlando is shocked to wake up as a woman and returns home, struggling as a female to retain her property as the centuries roll by.

2025-06-04.title: SXSW: Luna Rosa: The Seventh Ascension of Atabey
2025-06-04.synopsis: The Mars Volta’s leading man Omar Rodríguez-López makes his directorial debut with this stunningly shot blend of science fiction and dystopia set on the island of Borinquen, the Indigenous Taíno name for the island of Puerto Rico. Our hero here is Zur’na (Flora Sylvestre), who sets out to the neighbouring enemy territories ruled by American colonial forces on a quest to find her missing brother. Through Zur’na’s eventful journey, Rodríguez-López skillfully denounces the still very present ripples of American imperialism while referencing classic Latin American cinema and cult B-movies to craft a pulsating universe featuring intricate rituals, mind-control, and threatening holograms.

2025-06-04.title: SXSW: Ancestral Visions of the Future
2025-06-04.synopsis: Following his 2019 breakout This Is Not a Burial, It’s a Resurrection, filmmaker and visual artist Lemohang Jeremiah Mosese returns to his home of Lesotho to reflect on the diasporic experience of living in exile in Berlin. Based on Mosese’s 2023 eponymous exhibition and intimately narrated by the filmmaker, Ancestral Visions of the Future is a singular, time-bending experimental work that floods the big screen with dreamlike, striking imagery of a childhood relived through joy and an aching sense of pained displacement.

2025-06-04.title: SXSW: Winter in Sokcho
2025-06-04.synopsis: Sooha’s (Bella Kim) pleasant, if dull, life is interrupted by the arrival of an enigmatic guest at the guest house where she works. Firstly, no one really travels during the winter to the remote South Korean town of Sokcho. And secondly, he is French, just like the father who she never met. The arrival of this stranger (Roschdy Zem) sends the young woman into a tailspin of doubts and memories as she struggles with understanding her own place in the world. Koya Kamura’s adaptation of Elisa Shua Dusapin’s acclaimed novel brings to the surface the themes of identity and vulnerability. Anna Bogutskaya

2025-06-04.title: SXSW: Mother's Baby
2025-06-04.synopsis: Julia and Georg really, really want a baby. After several unsuccessful fertility treatments, the solution appears in the form of an experimental treatment by Dr. Vilfort (Claes Bang). However, something happens during the birth, and their baby is taken away for additional treatment, leaving the couple helpless and in the dark about what is truly going on. When the doctor returns their child, Julia finds it impossible to connect with her son. Is the baby hers, or is there something darker at play?

2025-06-04.title: SXSW: Beef
2025-06-04.synopsis: Ingride Santos presents the story of Lati, a young Black woman rapper trying to break into the often racist and misogynistic underground battle rap scene in Spain. Not only must Lati overcome the challenges of any budding creative, she must also reconcile her passion for freestyle with her mother’s Muslim faith, finding in the throbbing beats of rap music not only a much-needed escape but also the chance to express herself in defiance of those who aim to suppress her. Santos’ short film of the same name, was previously nominated for a  Goya.

2025-06-04.title: SXSW: Shorts: Laws of Desire
2025-06-04.synopsis: Desire delves into the complexities of human connection in the digital age, intimacy, and self-empowerment. From the quiet yearning of a remote worker’s obsession to a young man's turmoil over exposing himself online, these films explore how desire shapes our experiences. The programme traverses diverse narratives, from a 1980s sexual awakening at the cinema, to an Elvis impersonator navigating the increasingly blurred boundaries between subculture and self, to an Embera girl finding liberation through laughter. It’s a bold, intimate look at connection, obsession, and self-discovery.

2025-06-04.title: Hallow Road
2025-06-04.synopsis: Two parents receive a distressing late-night call from their teenage daughter, who has just accidentally hit a pedestrian. They jump in their car, racing to get there before anyone else stumbles across the scene. As they head deeper into the night, disturbing revelations threaten to tear the family apart as they soon realise they might not be the only ones driving down Hallow Road.

2025-06-04.title: Parthenope
2025-06-04.synopsis: From Academy Award-winning fi lmmaker Paolo Sorrentino comes a monumental and deeply romantic story of a lifetime. Born in the Bay of Naples in 1950, Parthenope (Celeste Dalla Porta) searches for happiness over the long summers of her youth, falling in love with her home city and its many memorable characters. But when tragedy strikes, and carefree romances lose their thrill, she decides to seek a deeper sense of purpose. Featuring a captivating performance from Dalla Porta and an outstanding cast that includes Gary Oldman, PARTHENOPE is another tale of great beauty from a master of modern cinema.

2025-06-04.title: Holy Cow
2025-06-04.synopsis: 18-year-old Totone spends most of his time drinking beer and partying in the Jura region with his group of friends until reality catches up with him when he has to take care of his 7-year-old sister and find a way to make a living. He sets out to make the best Comté cheese in the region in an attempt to win the gold medal at the agricultural competition and 30,000 euros.

2025-06-04.title: DocHouse: Burden of Dreams
2025-06-04.synopsis:
For five years, Werner Herzog desperately tried to complete FITZCARRALDO, despite every possible setback, an evermore unhinged Klaus Kinski and his own diehard insistence on hauling a steamship over a mountain. 

Luckily, Les Blank captured it all in this riveting account of the whole crazed process, from losing cast members (Jason Robards Jr., Mick Jagger), to a prop ship trapped in rapids, and Herzog haranguing hundreds of indigenous people to pull the 320-ton steamship up a muddy mountain. Anchored by an as-it-was-happening interview with Herzog himself, BURDEN OF DREAMS is a wild insight into his unflinching vision and the lengths he would go to to realise it.

2025-06-04.title: Motel Destino
2025-06-04.synopsis: The unexpected arrival of 21-year-old Heraldo, on the run after a botched hit, disrupts the established order at Motel Destino, a roadside sex hotel steaming under the burning blue skies of Brazil, run by hot-headed Elias and his restless younger wife Dayana.

2025-06-04.title: DocHouse: Bogancloch
2025-06-04.synopsis: Bogancloch is where Jake Williams lives, nestled in a vast highland forest of Scotland. The film portrays his life throughout the seasons, with other people occasionally crossing into his otherwise solitary life. At the heart a song, an argument between life and death, each stating their case to rule over the world. The film is without exposition, it aims at something less recognisable, a different existence of reality observed in discrete moments. A sequel to Two Years at Sea (2011), charting a subtly changing life in a radically changing world.

2025-06-04.title: DocHouse: Riefenstahl
2025-06-04.synopsis: Explores Leni Riefenstahl's artistic legacy and her complex ties to the Nazi regime, juxtaposing her self-portrayal with evidence suggesting awareness of the regime's atrocities.

2025-06-05.title: Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning

2025-06-05.title: NT Live: A Streetcar Named Desire
2025-06-05.synopsis: Gillian Anderson (Sex Education), Vanessa Kirby (The Crown), and Ben Foster (Lone Survivor) lead the cast in Tennessee Williams’ timeless masterpiece, returning to cinemas.   As Blanche’s fragile world crumbles, she turns to her sister Stella for solace – but her downward spiral brings her face to face with the brutal, unforgiving Stanley Kowalski.      From visionary director Benedict Andrews, this acclaimed production was filmed live during a sold-out run at the Young Vic Theatre in 2014.

2025-06-05.title: YouTube Ciné-Club: Average Rob - Toughest Footrace
2025-06-05.synopsis:
Catch this documentary in a special advance screening with Average Rob and the film team in attendance.

Average Rob and Arno The Kid head deep into the Moroccan desert to take on the legendary Marathon des Sables — a spontaneous decision that turns into a brutal battle against heat, injury, and their own limits. What follows is a raw physical and mental trial with no filters and no excuses.
After six months of intense preparation, Rob & Arno find themselves at the starting line of an almost impossible challenge: a grueling 250-kilometer trek through the blazing Sahara Desert, where they face sandstorms, unbearable heat, and complete exhaustion.

From the first training session to the final step across the finish line, this documentary offers an unfiltered look at the incredible journey the brothers undertake. Along the way, they meet inspiring individuals, each confronting their own inner battle on the world’s hottest stage.

An inspiring documentary about doing the impossible – and still being able to laugh about it, brought to you by The YouTube Cinéclub by mk2.

2025-06-05.title: SXSW: Shorts: Midnight Movies
2025-06-05.synopsis: As the night gets darker and sleep deprivation kicks in, sit back, relax and help yourself to a block of our most unhinged shorts. Chaos ensues as a young actress fakes her own kidnapping and a father grapples with an unusual abdominal growth due to empty nest syndrome. Meanwhile, a mysterious otherworldly entity struggles with an identity crisis - and a naive man seeks revenge by embarking  on a surreal quest  through the underbelly of the  South Wales Valleys. Join us and bathe in the collective absurdity of these twisted tales and brainworms.

2025-06-05.title: SXSW: The Square
2025-06-05.synopsis: Deployed to Pyongyang, First Secretary of Sweden Isak Borg lives in a gruelling state of Groundhog Day, his meticulously designed routine allowing for no social interaction outside the constrictions of his bureaucratic job. What his boss doesn’t know, however, is that Isak has been secretly meeting a local traffic security officer, breaking the rules of his profession but nurturing his need for emotional connection. When his lover disappears, Isak begins a frantic search that sees The Square spiral into a whirlwind of paranoia, betrayal, and the unwavering power of love.

2025-06-05.title: SXSW: My Uncle Jens
2025-06-05.synopsis: Late one night, the fairly quiet, comfortable life led by literature teacher Akam is turned upside down when his estranged uncle from the Iranian part of Kurdistan knocks on his door without warning. Despite sharing his apartment with two flatmates and having only a modest single bed, Akam takes the old man in, the originally brief visit turning into a much longer, more inconvenient stay as Akam begins to unravel the secrets behind his uncle’s resurgence. My Uncle Jens is a sensitive meditation on displacement that will have you belly laughing one second, fetching tissues the other.

2025-06-05.title: SXSW: The Things You Kill
2025-06-05.synopsis: The unexpected death of his disabled mother haunts university professor Ali, whose grief soon turns to anger towards his father, a volatile, abusive man Ali believes has something to do with his late wife’s death. This hatred sends the academic on a mission to uncover the truth that quickly morphs into obsession, taking over Ali’s life and alienating those who love him. Alireza Khatami’s genre-bending surrealist thriller plays with the malleability of reality as a once-stable man falls deeper and deeper into a whirlwind of rage, guilt, and loss, soon being replaced by a bolder, more unhinged version of himself.

2025-06-05.title: SXSW: A Missing Part
2025-06-05.synopsis: Renowned French actor Romain Durris leads this poignant drama as taxi driver Jay, a father unable to leave Tokyo due to a years-long legal battle with his ex-wife over the custody of their daughter. Exhausted by the unmoving lawsuit and frustrated with having missed many years of his child’s life, Jay makes a drastic decision to be able to see his daughter again. At times tender, at others heartbreaking, A Missing Part exposes the rigidity of custody laws for mixed-nationality parents in Japan while movingly observing the camaraderie that can sprout out of desperation.

2025-06-05.title: Hallow Road
2025-06-05.synopsis: Two parents receive a distressing late-night call from their teenage daughter, who has just accidentally hit a pedestrian. They jump in their car, racing to get there before anyone else stumbles across the scene. As they head deeper into the night, disturbing revelations threaten to tear the family apart as they soon realise they might not be the only ones driving down Hallow Road.

2025-06-05.title: DocHouse: E.1027 - Eileen Gray
2025-06-05.synopsis:
A love triangle of jealousy in the Parisian art scene of the 1930s is brought to life in a stylish docufiction about iconic artist and architect Eileen Gray, who built her modernist dream house on the Riviera, only to be upstaged by Le Corbusier.

Eileen Gray had a truly eminent sense of design. The Irish artist and architect created some of the most iconic furniture of the 20th century, so when she focussed her unique artistic vision on developing a house for herself on the Riviera in 1929, the result was a modernist triumph. A house and a work of art in one, overlooking the sun-sparkled infinity of the Mediterranean. The house is named E.1027, a cryptic contraction of the names of Gray and her lover, Romanian architect Jean Badovici. But when the Swiss-French star architect Le Corbusier learns of the house, he becomes obsessed – perhaps because Gray breathes light, air and soul into her building, which is not just a machine to live in.

E.1027 – EILEEN GRAY AND THE HOUSE BY THE SEA reconstructs the dramatic story of Gray and the house that Le Corbusier amazingly managed to convince the world he had built himself. A stunningly beautiful and cinematic docufiction where the inspiration from Gray is present in lines, colours and shapes – but where they serve the narrative of a brilliant female artist who spent a long life in the shadow of her male colleagues.

The screening on Wed 4 Jun will be followed by a Q&A with director Beatrice Minger and actor Natalie Radmall-Quirke. Screening in partnership with The Architecture Club.

2025-06-05.title: Motel Destino
2025-06-05.synopsis: The unexpected arrival of 21-year-old Heraldo, on the run after a botched hit, disrupts the established order at Motel Destino, a roadside sex hotel steaming under the burning blue skies of Brazil, run by hot-headed Elias and his restless younger wife Dayana.

2025-06-05.title: DocHouse: The Extraordinary Miss Flower
2025-06-05.synopsis:
THE EXTRAORDINARY MISS FLOWER brings to life the remarkable story of Geraldine Flower and the discovery of a suitcase full of passionate, heartfelt letters of love sent to her in the 60s and 70s that inspired acclaimed Icelandic singer/songwriter Emilíana Torrini to return to the studio and record an entire album of new songs.

Part film, part theatre, part fever dream, THE EXTRAORDINARY MISS FLOWER takes the form of a series of specially designed performances of these songs by Emilíana and her band, combined with dramatic scenes and readings from the letters by well-known actors and musicians, including Caroline Catz, Nick Cave, Alice Lowe and Richard Ayoade.

The film captures the romance of a bygone era and Miss Flower’s extraordinary life – a life full of secrets and enduring friendships, of travel, adventure and love.

2025-06-05.title: DocHouse: Bogancloch
2025-06-05.synopsis: Bogancloch is where Jake Williams lives, nestled in a vast highland forest of Scotland. The film portrays his life throughout the seasons, with other people occasionally crossing into his otherwise solitary life. 2025-06-05.title: DocHouse: My Sweet Land
2025-06-05.synopsis:
Vrej, the subject of Sareen Hairabedian’s impressive feature debut – a striking coming-of-age tale – has grown up in Nagorno-Karabakh, an ethnic Armenian enclave within Azerbaijan. Since the end of the Soviet era it has witnessed much conflict. 

The 11-year-old watches birds, plays with friends and dreams of being a dentist. But echoes of the three wars his family have lived through since 1992 are ever-present. His grandmother laments the cycle of ethnic violence: ‘Living in Artsakh means that one day there will be a war and my grandson will participate in that war’. 

As his school lessons become increasingly militarised and Vrej struggles to hold on to his childhood dreams, his grandmother watches her prophecy unfold.

2025-06-06.title: The Ballad of Wallis Island
2025-06-06.synopsis: Eccentric lottery winner Charles dreams of getting his favorite musicians, McGwyer Mortimer, back together. The fantasy becomes real when the bandmates and former lovers agree to play a private show at his home on Wallis Island. Old tensions resurface as Charles tries desperately to salvage his dream gig.

2025-06-06.title: Ballerina
2025-06-06.synopsis: Taking place during the events of John Wick: Chapter 3 – Parabellum, the film follows Eve Macarro (Ana de Armas) who is beginning her training in the assassin traditions of the Ruska Roma.

2025-06-06.title: The Piano Teacher Re-Release
2025-06-06.synopsis: Academy Award–winning Austrian director Michael Haneke shifted his focus from the social to the psychological for this riveting study of female sexuality and the dynamics of control, an adaptation of a controversial 1983 novel by Elfriede Jelinek. Haneke finds his match in Isabelle Huppert, who delivers an icy but quietly seething performance as Erika, a middle-aged piano professor at a Viennese conservatory who lives with her mother, in a claustrophobically codependent relationship. Severely repressed, she satisfies her masochistic urges only voyeuristically until she meets Walter (Benoît Magimel), a young student whose desire for Erika leads to a destructive infatuation that upsets the careful equilibrium of her life. A critical breakthrough for Haneke, The Piano Teacher—which won the Grand Prix as well as dual acting awards for its stars at Cannes—is a formalist masterwork that remains a shocking sensation.

2025-06-06.title: The Encampments
2025-06-06.synopsis: Students flooded Columbia University’s lawn to create the Gaza Solidarity Encampment in order to pressure their university to divest from the US and Israeli weapons companies. THE ENCAMPMENTS follows the central organizers of the encampment as they are thrust into the spotlight, face violent police repression and suspension, congressional pressure, and a media firestorm, all while fighting to attain their goal of divestment at any cost.

2025-06-06.title: Film Club: Bound
2025-06-06.synopsis: Corky, a tough female ex con and her lover Violet concoct a scheme to steal millions of stashed mob money and pin the blame on Violet's crooked boyfriend Caesar.

2025-06-06.title: Lilo & Stitch
2025-06-06.synopsis: A live-action reimagining of Disney’s 2002 animated classic, “Lilo & Stitch” is the wildly funny and touching story of a lonely Hawaiian girl and the fugitive alien who helps to mend her broken family. Directed by Dean Fleischer Camp, the Oscar®-nominated filmmaker behind the animated feature film “Marcel the Shell with Shoes On,” the film stars Sydney Elizebeth Agudong, Billy Magnussen, Tia Carrere, Hannah Waddingham, Chris Sanders, with Courtney B. Vance, and Zach Galifianakis, introducing Maia Kealoha. “Lilo & Stitch” is produced by Jonathan Eirich, p.g.a. and Dan Lin, with Louie Provost, Tom Peitzman and Ryan Halprin serving as executive producers.

Yet the story is one of optimism, with Attenborough pointing to inspirational stories from around the world to deliver his greatest message: the ocean can recover to a glory beyond anything anyone alive has ever seen.

Screening in cinemas with theatrically exclusive footage.

2025-06-06.title: SXSW: Shorts: Work/Life
2025-06-06.synopsis: From the chaos of the workplace to the existential dilemmas of daily life, Work/Life presents a collection of films that examine the delicate balance between labour, identity, and survival. A frantic race through London, a traffic warden’s quiet rebellion, and a millennial’s bureaucratic nightmare reveal the absurdities of modern work. Meanwhile, a rock’s existential crisis, a surreal queer sci-fi, and a sharp critique of beauty standards question what it means to live beyond the structures imposed on us. Playful, poignant, and provocative, these films find humour, poetry, and defiance in the struggle to exist.

2025-06-06.title: SXSW: La Guitarra Flamenca de Yerai Cortes
2025-06-06.synopsis: Spanish Grammy-award-winning rapper Antón Álvarez, better known as C. Tangana, makes his directorial debut with this intimate look at the life of flamenco guitar player Yerai Cortés. Told through a deeper look into the history of the musician’s family, this poignant documentary sensitively explores gypsy culture through dissecting familial tragedies and traumas, looking at how such pain seeps into — and fuels — creativity. What may look like a traditional music documentary at first turns into a much more nuanced, rich snapshot of flamenco and its deep-rooted connections with notions of identity, prejudice, and community.

2025-06-06.title: SXSW: The Occupant
2025-06-06.synopsis: Refusing to accept her sister’s terminal diagnosis, geologist Abby (Ella Balinska) takes a job in the remote Georgian taiga to help pay for a new experimental treatment that might save her beloved sibling. Stuck in the wilderness after a crash, Abby must face the harsh elements to make her way back to her sister guided by the soothing voice of John (Rob Delaney, always welcome), an American pilot whose plane was also brought down. Guiding her through the harsh conditions, John seems to be a beacon of hope. Until he isn’t.

2025-06-06.title: SXSW: Forte
2025-06-06.synopsis: Budding composer Yeonji’s (Leem Chae-young) biggest dream comes true when she lands an entry-level position at the prestigious Forte Studio working on the score for a renowned director’s new film. Soon enough, what was once a dream begins to spiral into a nightmare as the young musician realises her boss — and main reference in the field — is not only overly demanding but also more than happy to take credit for her work. Kimbo Kim’s confidently paced debut cleverly plays with workplace tensions and issues of sexism and ageism to take Forte to a gory, thrilling apex set deep in the Korean woods.

2025-06-06.title: SXSW: Lesbian Space Princess
2025-06-06.synopsis: Princess Saira has just been dumped by her impossibly cool girlfriend Kiki for being too needy. Her sulking takes a sharp turn when her new ex calls with a cry for help: She has been kidnapped by a misogynist group known as the Straight While Maliens. The ransom? One of the most powerful weapons known to the lesbian kind. Lesbian Space Princess trails Saira’s quest through the galaxies to save her girl, from life-threatening missions to meeting gay-pop idols, the result a delightful animated queer comedy slash musical that won the prestigious Teddy Award at this year’s Berlin Film Festival.

2025-06-06.title: SXSW: Spiegelman: Disaster is My Muse
2025-06-06.synopsis: In the 45 years since the original publication of the groundbreaking MAUS — a graphic novel about the Holocaust that changed not only the conversation around the Jewish diaspora in the US but also redefined the possibilities of the medium — Art Spiegelman’s work has only become more relevant. This insightful documentary chronicles the life of the trailblazing artist as he recalls how his painful family history shaped his craft while making a vital parallel to the global politics of today, touching upon issues of authoritarianism, creative rebellion, and censorship. A treat for Spielgeman fans old and new.

2025-06-06.title: SXSW: UNBOUND
2025-06-06.synopsis: With more than half of London's LGBTQ+ venues closed, Unbound celebrates queer nightlife as a space of community and creativity. Artists and filmmakers Ewelina Tikul Aleksandrowicz and Andrzej Wojtas, who go by the artist name PXKRW (aka Pussykrew), film their subjects as royalty. There’s Seba, a former opera singer in navigating their transformation; Lewis, a seasoned club night promoter and activist; and Kaiden, a non-binary artist and self-described “energy bender”. Through their stories, as well as ravishing, immersive imagery, Unbound highlights how these spaces serve as sanctuaries of self-expression, resistance, and healing.

2025-06-06.title: SXSW: Cadet
2025-06-06.synopsis: Single mother Alina enrolls her shy, quiet son Serik in an elite military academy, using his father’s high military ranking to ensure his acceptance. But the boys are brutal, and the principal is worse, isolating and demeaning Serik. Meanwhile, a bigger threat looms, something dark and unseen that comes from the basement of the old Soviet building. Kazakh director Adilkhan Yerzhanov’s first foray into horror is big on atmosphere, using the built-in creepiness of isolated, old structures to create some truly terrifying moments.

2025-06-06.title: Hallow Road
2025-06-06.synopsis: Two parents receive a distressing late-night call from their teenage daughter, who has just accidentally hit a pedestrian. They jump in their car, racing to get there before anyone else stumbles across the scene. As they head deeper into the night, disturbing revelations threaten to tear the family apart as they soon realise they might not be the only ones driving down Hallow Road.

2025-06-06.title: NT Live: A Streetcar Named Desire
2025-06-06.synopsis: Gillian Anderson (Sex Education), Vanessa Kirby (The Crown), and Ben Foster (Lone Survivor) lead the cast in Tennessee Williams’ timeless masterpiece, returning to cinemas.   As Blanche’s fragile world crumbles, she turns to her sister Stella for solace – but her downward spiral brings her face to face with the brutal, unforgiving Stanley Kowalski.      From visionary director Benedict Andrews, this acclaimed production was filmed live during a sold-out run at the Young Vic Theatre in 2014.

2025-06-06.title: Parthenope
2025-06-06.synopsis: From Academy Award-winning fi lmmaker Paolo Sorrentino comes a monumental and deeply romantic story of a lifetime. Born in the Bay of Naples in 1950, Parthenope (Celeste Dalla Porta) searches for happiness over the long summers of her youth, falling in love with her home city and its many memorable characters. But when tragedy strikes, and carefree romances lose their thrill, she decides to seek a deeper sense of purpose. Featuring a captivating performance from Dalla Porta and an outstanding cast that includes Gary Oldman, PARTHENOPE is another tale of great beauty from a master of modern cinema.

2025-06-06.title: DocHouse: The Last Republican
2025-06-06.synopsis:
US Congressman Adam Kinzinger was the first Republican to hold Donald Trump accountable for the Jan 6th attack on the Capital, jeopardising his career and drawing vitriol from his own party in the process.  

A champion of conservative values, Kinzinger became an ardent critic of Trump, voting for his impeachment, though it cost him colleagues, friends and family. Hollywood director and comedian Steve Pink - himself a far left progressive - profiles Kinzinger during his last year in Congress as he, seemingly alone amongst Republicans, takes a stand. 

While Pink persistently challenges Kinzinger on his political views, he forms a surprisingly humourous friendship with his conservative Christian counterpart.

2025-06-06.title: Holy Cow
2025-06-06.synopsis: 18-year-old Totone spends most of his time drinking beer and partying in the Jura region with his group of friends until reality catches up with him when he has to take care of his 7-year-old sister and find a way to make a living. He sets out to make the best Comté cheese in the region in an attempt to win the gold medal at the agricultural competition and 30,000 euros.

2025-06-06.title: Motel Destino
2025-06-06.synopsis: The unexpected arrival of 21-year-old Heraldo, on the run after a botched hit, disrupts the established order at Motel Destino, a roadside sex hotel steaming under the burning blue skies of Brazil, run by hot-headed Elias and his restless younger wife Dayana.

2025-06-06.title: DocHouse: The Encampments
2025-06-06.synopsis:
The student protests that ignited at Columbia University in April 2024 made waves around the world. As the institution tried to shut down the Gaza Solidarity Encampment by force, the student movement grew, sparking encampments at hundreds of other campuses across the US.

With gripping, ground-level footage and intimate interviews with student leaders, THE ENCAMPMENTS charts the growth of the movement, as the students face police raids, disinformation, media attacks and the strongest of threats from the universities themselves.

Featuring detained activist Mahmoud Khalil, alongside professors, whistleblowers, and other student leaders, this timely film captures the deeper stakes of a historic moment that continues to reverberate across the globe.

2025-06-06.title: DocHouse: E.1027 - Eileen Gray
2025-06-06.synopsis:
A love triangle of jealousy in the Parisian art scene of the 1930s is brought to life in a stylish docufiction about iconic artist and architect Eileen Gray, who built her modernist dream house on the Riviera, only to be upstaged by Le Corbusier.

Eileen Gray had a truly eminent sense of design. The Irish artist and architect created some of the most iconic furniture of the 20th century, so when she focussed her unique artistic vision on developing a house for herself on the Riviera in 1929, the result was a modernist triumph. A house and a work of art in one, overlooking the sun-sparkled infinity of the Mediterranean. The house is named E.1027, a cryptic contraction of the names of Gray and her lover, Romanian architect Jean Badovici. But when the Swiss-French star architect Le Corbusier learns of the house, he becomes obsessed – perhaps because Gray breathes light, air and soul into her building, which is not just a machine to live in.

E.1027 – EILEEN GRAY AND THE HOUSE BY THE SEA reconstructs the dramatic story of Gray and the house that Le Corbusier amazingly managed to convince the world he had built himself. A stunningly beautiful and cinematic docufiction where the inspiration from Gray is present in lines, colours and shapes – but where they serve the narrative of a brilliant female artist who spent a long life in the shadow of her male colleagues.

The screening on Wed 4 Jun will be followed by a Q&A with director Beatrice Minger and actor Natalie Radmall-Quirke. Screening in partnership with The Architecture Club.

2025-06-07.title: The Ballad of Wallis Island
2025-06-07.synopsis: Eccentric lottery winner Charles dreams of getting his favorite musicians, McGwyer Mortimer, back together. The fantasy becomes real when the bandmates and former lovers agree to play a private show at his home on Wallis Island. Old tensions resurface as Charles tries desperately to salvage his dream gig.

2025-06-07.title: Ballerina
2025-06-07.synopsis: Taking place during the events of John Wick: Chapter 3 – Parabellum, the film follows Eve Macarro (Ana de Armas) who is beginning her training in the assassin traditions of the Ruska Roma.

2025-06-07.title: Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning
2025-06-07.synopsis: Light the fuse because Tom Cruise's world-saving super spy Ethan Hunt is back to complete a mission for the ages alongside Simon Pegg, Ving Rhames and Hayley Atwell. This propulsive action-adventure demands to be seen on the big screen.

2025-06-07.title: The Phoenician Scheme
2025-06-07.synopsis: The story of a family and a family business. Starring: Benicio del Toro as Zsa-zsa Korda, one of the richest men in Europe; Mia Threapleton as Liesl, his daughter/a nun; Michael Cera as Bjorn, their tutor. With: Riz Ahmed, Tom Hanks, Bryan Cranston, Mathieu Amalric, Richard Ayoade, Jeffrey Wright, Scarlett Johansson, Benedict Cumberbatch, Rupert Friend, Hope Davis.

2025-06-07.title: Sinners
2025-06-07.synopsis: Trying to leave their troubled lives behind, twin brothers (Jordan) return to their hometown to start again, only to discover that an even greater evil is waiting to welcome them back.

2025-06-07.title: Final Destination: Bloodlines
2025-06-07.synopsis: The newest chapter in New Line Cinema’s bloody successful franchise takes audiences back to the very beginning of Death’s twisted sense of justice. Plagued by a violent recurring nightmare, college student Stefanie heads home to track down the one person who might be able to break the cycle and save her family from the grisly demise that inevitably awaits them all.

2025-06-07.title: Along Came Love
2025-06-07.synopsis: A hotel waitress Madeleine who is mother to a little boy, meets a rich student François. The relation between them becomes so intense, but over time it's evident that François is trying to escape by entangling Madeleine's destiny with his.

2025-06-07.title: The Encampments
2025-06-07.synopsis: Students flooded Columbia University’s lawn to create the Gaza Solidarity Encampment in order to pressure their university to divest from the US and Israeli weapons companies. THE ENCAMPMENTS follows the central organizers of the encampment as they are thrust into the spotlight, face violent police repression and suspension, congressional pressure, and a media firestorm, all while fighting to attain their goal of divestment at any cost.

2025-06-07.title: The Piano Teacher Re-Release
2025-06-07.synopsis: Academy Award–winning Austrian director Michael Haneke shifted his focus from the social to the psychological for this riveting study of female sexuality and the dynamics of control, an adaptation of a controversial 1983 novel by Elfriede Jelinek. Haneke finds his match in Isabelle Huppert, who delivers an icy but quietly seething performance as Erika, a middle-aged piano professor at a Viennese conservatory who lives with her mother, in a claustrophobically codependent relationship. Severely repressed, she satisfies her masochistic urges only voyeuristically until she meets Walter (Benoît Magimel), a young student whose desire for Erika leads to a destructive infatuation that upsets the careful equilibrium of her life. A critical breakthrough for Haneke, The Piano Teacher—which won the Grand Prix as well as dual acting awards for its stars at Cannes—is a formalist masterwork that remains a shocking sensation.

2025-06-07.title: Lilo & Stitch
2025-06-07.synopsis: A live-action reimagining of Disney’s 2002 animated classic, “Lilo & Stitch” is the wildly funny and touching story of a lonely Hawaiian girl and the fugitive alien who helps to mend her broken family. Directed by Dean Fleischer Camp, the Oscar®-nominated filmmaker behind the animated feature film “Marcel the Shell with Shoes On,” the film stars Sydney Elizebeth Agudong, Billy Magnussen, Tia Carrere, Hannah Waddingham, Chris Sanders, with Courtney B. Vance, and Zach Galifianakis, introducing Maia Kealoha. “Lilo & Stitch” is produced by Jonathan Eirich, p.g.a. and Dan Lin, with Louie Provost, Tom Peitzman and Ryan Halprin serving as executive producers.

Screening in cinemas with theatrically exclusive footage.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: The Nature Of Invisible Things
2025-06-07.synopsis: Gloria (Laura Brandão) is a 10-year-old spending her summer holidays in the hospital where her nurse mother works long shifts. While wandering the never-ending corridors of the old building, Gloria meets Sofia (Serena), a young girl frightened by her beloved grandma’s recent hospitalisation. A friendship blossoms out of their mutual desire to spend summer away from the hospital, and the duo soon gets their way when their mothers agree to take them on a countryside adventure. Camelo’s feature debut is a tenderhearted ode to childhood friendships and a joyful modern coming-of-age anchored by its charismatic young performers.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Shorts: Truth + Lies
2025-06-07.synopsis: A white lie never hurt anyone, right? What happens when we confront conspiracy and face the harsh truths of our world versus our self-crafted narratives? This collection of shorts examines the realities we create, from a dating app mishap to a young woman's struggle with her mother's sudden disappearance. A barber uncovers a local politician's transformation into a donkey, while a struggling artist fakes being a famous photographer. This programme challenges our perception of reality and unearths the myriad of lies weave for ourselves and others.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Ancestral Visions of the Future
2025-06-07.synopsis: Following his 2019 breakout This Is Not a Burial, It’s a Resurrection, filmmaker and visual artist Lemohang Jeremiah Mosese returns to his home of Lesotho to reflect on the diasporic experience of living in exile in Berlin. Based on Mosese’s 2023 eponymous exhibition and intimately narrated by the filmmaker, Ancestral Visions of the Future is a singular, time-bending experimental work that floods the big screen with dreamlike, striking imagery of a childhood relived through joy and an aching sense of pained displacement.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: There Was, There Was Not
2025-06-07.synopsis: Armenian tales often forgo the Westernised “once upon a time” to begin with “there was, there was not.” That is also the starting point of this illuminating doc about a country that lingers between two wars, home to four women who find themselves reckoning with their national past while looking for strength to fight for its future. From a local politician to a hopeful athlete, There Was, There Was Not piercingly looks at the role of women in life — and conflict — as another war erupts and the countrywomen must once again fight for survival.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Queer As Punk
2025-06-07.synopsis: Queer Malay band Shh…Diam — amusingly named after the Malay expression for “shut up” — sing, shout, and riff about the realities of being trans and queer in modern Malaysia as they navigate relationships and their sense of belonging in the world pre and post-COVID. Queer as Punk is a subervise portrayal of openly queer creatives in a country where same-sex relationships are still illegal, with director Yihwen Chen broaching urgent conversations around the importance of community and the unyielding power of creativity as a bridge — all with plenty of bizarre music lyrics, even more bizarre real stories, chroma key outfits, and a whole lot of charm.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Night Silence
2025-06-07.synopsis: About to turn 80, retired actor Lucjan (Maciej Damiecki) is admitted by his son into what appears to be a peaceful nursing home nestled in the quiet countryside. The son is about to become a father himself and says it is only temporary, but Lucjan soon begins to be confronted with sinister signs that his stay might be more permanent than it seems. With Night Silence, Hellhole director Bartosz M. Kowalski finely walks the line between the tender and the eerie as existential conversations about love and loss happen as mysterious creatures crawl under the creaking floors.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Munroe Bergdorf: Love & Rage
2025-06-07.synopsis: In this intimate documentary, director Olivia Cappuccini chronicles the life of one of our great modern British icons: activist, writer, model, and influencer Munroe Bergdorf. Seesawing between bold, dreamlike reconstructions of Bergdorf’s childhood and honest testimonials on her experience being swept under the relentless scrutiny of the UK media, Love & Rage sensitively employs the vulnerability of Bergdorf’s personal life and experiences to investigate ever-vital systemic issues of transphobia, homophobia, and racism, all while reiterating the importance of community and painting a portrayal of what modern activism looks like. It is an inspiring insight into the resilience required of a trailblazer.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Late Shift
2025-06-07.synopsis: In the hospital, things don’t slow down at night. Dedicated and tireless surgical nurse Floria (played by The Teacher Lounge’s Leonie Benesch) must navigate the demands of her patients, a hugely understaffed ward, and the unrelenting avalanche of emergencies, all with a smile and no room for error. That is, until a single mistake threatens to derail her shift with grave consequences. Petra Volpe’s tight direction and Benesch’s performance will leave audiences in urgent need of a stress ball.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: The Old Woman With the Knife
2025-06-07.synopsis: Based on the book by Gu Byeong-mo, this sleek, action-filled thriller follows Hornclaw, a woman whose job is to clean the city of “human vermin.” A legendary assassin with over four decades on the job, the titular knife-yielding badass must face a new definition of vermin when she finds herself fighting possible proteges turned enemies, who all come looking for revenge. Despite her ageing body, Hornclaw’s killer instinct remains younger than ever; this new, dangerous mission heightens her stealth mind and gives the contract killer a new purpose in life when she least expects it.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Everyone Is Lying To You For Money
2025-06-07.synopsis: One may be sceptical when reading that a famous actor slash former teen heartthrob did a big career pivot into cryptocurrency, but Ben McKenzie’s directorial debut is swift to poke fun at the stereotype of the Hollywood poster boy for crypto. With Everyone Is Lying To You For Money, the The OC and Gotham star at first sets out to understand what cryptocurrency is, diving deep into the world of digital money to uncover a darker, much more devastating reality. The result is not only widely informative and entertaining.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Winter in Sokcho
2025-06-07.synopsis: Sooha’s (Bella Kim) pleasant, if dull, life is interrupted by the arrival of an enigmatic guest at the guest house where she works. Firstly, no one really travels during the winter to the remote South Korean town of Sokcho. And secondly, he is French, just like the father who she never met. The arrival of this stranger (Roschdy Zem) sends the young woman into a tailspin of doubts and memories as she struggles with understanding her own place in the world. Koya Kamura’s adaptation of Elisa Shua Dusapin’s acclaimed novel brings to the surface the themes of identity and vulnerability. Anna Bogutskaya

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Sunshine Express
2025-06-07.synopsis: A group of strangers signs up to take a ride aboard a fake train headed to the fictional island of Hernmia. The catch? They all agree to enter the train not as themselves, but as carefully designed characters in a role-playing game. This premise, which kicks off Sunshine Express, proves a fertile allegory to examine the cogs of totalitarian systems and how authoritarianism often survives through not only shared complicity but a cruelly enforced sense of otherness. By drinking from the fountains of Bong Joon-ho and Jafar Panahi, Navaee crafts a tense, deeply nuanced political thriller in this promising feature debut.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: The Life of Chuck
2025-06-07.synopsis: Mike Flanagan’s name has become synonymous with horror, after his successful adaptations of beloved ghost classics The Haunting of Hill House and The Haunting of Bly Manor. The Life of Chuck is the third of his collaborations with Stephen King, whose work he previously adapted in Gerald’s Game and Doctor Sleep. Less interested in scares than in life affirming sincerity, the film is a cosy science fiction tale of an extraordinary ordinary man called Charles Kantz, ever present in the lives of every citizen of a town on the brink of apocalypse. The less said the better. The film unfolds like an uplifting  reminder that everyone contains multitudes.

2025-06-07.title: SXSW: Dead By Dawn
2025-06-07.synopsis: It’s Christmas Eve and a young troupe of actors has just arrived at an imposing baroque theater to rehearse for a new play about witchcraft penned by a mysterious, reclusive playwright. As soon as they enter the building, phone signal goes down. Then things start to feel off. Then bodies begin to drop down like flies. David Torrone drinks from the fountain of giallo to build this gory, highly entertaining game of cat and mouse with a deliciously camp villain that makes the Phantom of the Opera seem like a benevolent arts patron.

2025-06-07.title: Kids Club: Peppa Meets the Baby Cinema Experience
2025-06-07.synopsis: PIG changes are coming! Join Peppa Pig and her family at the cinema as they get ready for their biggest adventure yet: welcoming a new baby! There’s no better time to embark on a full house renovation, shop for a new car and make special memories together. Celebrate the beginning of an exciting new era of Peppa Pig at this special, big screen experience with an hour of laughter, tears and loads of heartwarming moments. With 10 oinktastic new episodes, 6 brand new songs and music videos, your little ones can dance and sing along with Peppa and her family and friends. The wait is finally over... join Peppa and George as they meet their new baby sibling for the first time at Peppa Meets the Baby Cinema Experience!

2025-06-07.title: Hallow Road
2025-06-07.synopsis: Two parents receive a distressing late-night call from their teenage daughter, who has just accidentally hit a pedestrian. They jump in their car, racing to get there before anyone else stumbles across the scene. As they head deeper into the night, disturbing revelations threaten to tear the family apart as they soon realise they might not be the only ones driving down Hallow Road.

But when tragedy strikes, and carefree romances lose their thrill, she decides to seek a deeper sense of purpose. Featuring a captivating performance from Dalla Porta and an outstanding cast that includes Gary Oldman, PARTHENOPE is another tale of great beauty from a master of modern cinema.

2025-06-07.title: DocHouse: My Sweet Land
2025-06-07.synopsis:
Vrej, the subject of Sareen Hairabedian’s impressive feature debut – a striking coming-of-age tale – has grown up in Nagorno-Karabakh, an ethnic Armenian enclave within Azerbaijan. Since the end of the Soviet era it has witnessed much conflict. 

The 11-year-old watches birds, plays with friends and dreams of being a dentist. But echoes of the three wars his family have lived through since 1992 are ever-present. His grandmother laments the cycle of ethnic violence: ‘Living in Artsakh means that one day there will be a war and my grandson will participate in that war’. 

As his school lessons become increasingly militarised and Vrej struggles to hold on to his childhood dreams, his grandmother watches her prophecy unfold.

2025-06-07.title: Holy Cow
2025-06-07.synopsis: 18-year-old Totone spends most of his time drinking beer and partying in the Jura region with his group of friends until reality catches up with him when he has to take care of his 7-year-old sister and find a way to make a living. He sets out to make the best Comté cheese in the region in an attempt to win the gold medal at the agricultural competition and 30,000 euros.

2025-06-07.title: DocHouse: The Encampments

The student protests that ignited at Columbia University in April 2024 made waves around the world. As the institution tried to shut down the Gaza Solidarity Encampment by force, the student movement grew, sparking encampments at hundreds of other campuses across the US.

With gripping, ground-level footage and intimate interviews with student leaders, THE ENCAMPMENTS charts the growth of the movement, as the students face police raids, disinformation, media attacks and the strongest of threats from the universities themselves.

Featuring detained activist Mahmoud Khalil, alongside professors, whistleblowers, and other student leaders, this timely film captures the deeper stakes of a historic moment that continues to reverberate across the globe.

2025-06-07.title: DocHouse: E.1027 - Eileen Gray
2025-06-07.synopsis:
A love triangle of jealousy in the Parisian art scene of the 1930s is brought to life in a stylish docufiction about iconic artist and architect Eileen Gray, who built her modernist dream house on the Riviera, only to be upstaged by Le Corbusier.

Eileen Gray had a truly eminent sense of design. The Irish artist and architect created some of the most iconic furniture of the 20th century, so when she focussed her unique artistic vision on developing a house for herself on the Riviera in 1929, the result was a modernist triumph. A house and a work of art in one, overlooking the sun-sparkled infinity of the Mediterranean. The house is named E.1027, a cryptic contraction of the names of Gray and her lover, Romanian architect Jean Badovici. But when the Swiss-French star architect Le Corbusier learns of the house, he becomes obsessed – perhaps because Gray breathes light, air and soul into her building, which is not just a machine to live in.

E.1027 – EILEEN GRAY AND THE HOUSE BY THE SEA reconstructs the dramatic story of Gray and the house that Le Corbusier amazingly managed to convince the world he had built himself. A stunningly beautiful and cinematic docufiction where the inspiration from Gray is present in lines, colours and shapes – but where they serve the narrative of a brilliant female artist who spent a long life in the shadow of her male colleagues.

The screening on Wed 4 Jun will be followed by a Q&A with director Beatrice Minger and actor Natalie Radmall-Quirke. Screening in partnership with The Architecture Club.

2025-06-07.title: Motel Destino
2025-06-07.synopsis: The unexpected arrival of 21-year-old Heraldo, on the run after a botched hit, disrupts the established order at Motel Destino, a roadside sex hotel steaming under the burning blue skies of Brazil, run by hot-headed Elias and his restless younger wife Dayana.

2025-06-08.title: The Ballad of Wallis Island
2025-06-08.synopsis: Eccentric lottery winner Charles dreams of getting his favorite musicians, McGwyer Mortimer, back together. The fantasy becomes real when the bandmates and former lovers agree to play a private show at his home on Wallis Island. Old tensions resurface as Charles tries desperately to salvage his dream gig.

2025-06-08.title: NT Live: A Streetcar Named Desire
2025-06-08.synopsis: Gillian Anderson (Sex Education), Vanessa Kirby (The Crown), and Ben Foster (Lone Survivor) lead the cast in Tennessee Williams’ timeless masterpiece, returning to cinemas.   As Blanche’s fragile world crumbles, she turns to her sister Stella for solace – but her downward spiral brings her face to face with the brutal, unforgiving Stanley Kowalski.      From visionary director Benedict Andrews, this acclaimed production was filmed live during a sold-out run at the Young Vic Theatre in 2014.

2025-06-08.title: Final Destination: Bloodlines
2025-06-08.synopsis: The newest chapter in New Line Cinema’s bloody successful franchise takes audiences back to the very beginning of Death’s twisted sense of justice. Plagued by a violent recurring nightmare, college student Stefanie heads home to track down the one person who might be able to break the cycle and save her family from the grisly demise that inevitably awaits them all.

2025-06-08.title: Sinners
2025-06-08.synopsis: Trying to leave their troubled lives behind, twin brothers (Jordan) return to their hometown to start again, only to discover that an even greater evil is waiting to welcome them back.

2025-06-08.title: Along Came Love
2025-06-08.synopsis: A hotel waitress Madeleine who is mother to a little boy, meets a rich student François. The relation between them becomes so intense, but over time it's evident that François is trying to escape by entangling Madeleine's destiny with his.

2025-06-08.title: The Piano Teacher Re-Release
2025-06-08.synopsis: Academy Award–winning Austrian director Michael Haneke shifted his focus from the social to the psychological for this riveting study of female sexuality and the dynamics of control, an adaptation of a controversial 1983 novel by Elfriede Jelinek. Haneke finds his match in Isabelle Huppert, who delivers an icy but quietly seething performance as Erika, a middle-aged piano professor at a Viennese conservatory who lives with her mother, in a claustrophobically codependent relationship. Severely repressed, she satisfies her masochistic urges only voyeuristically until she meets Walter (Benoît Magimel), a young student whose desire for Erika leads to a destructive infatuation that upsets the careful equilibrium of her life. A critical breakthrough for Haneke, The Piano Teacher—which won the Grand Prix as well as dual acting awards for its stars at Cannes—is a formalist masterwork that remains a shocking sensation.

2025-06-08.title: Flow
2025-06-08.synopsis: When a flood of biblical proportions washes its home away, a solitary cat must seek refuge with a motley crew of animals (including a dog, a capybara, a lemur and a secretarybird), who gradually learn to get along in this endearing, Oscar-winning animation.

2025-06-08.title: The Encampments
2025-06-08.synopsis: Students flooded Columbia University’s lawn to create the Gaza Solidarity Encampment in order to pressure their university to divest from the US and Israeli weapons companies. THE ENCAMPMENTS follows the central organizers of the encampment as they are thrust into the spotlight, face violent police repression and suspension, congressional pressure, and a media firestorm, all while fighting to attain their goal of divestment at any cost.

2025-06-08.title: Lilo & Stitch
2025-06-08.synopsis: A live-action reimagining of Disney’s 2002 animated classic, “Lilo & Stitch” is the wildly funny and touching story of a lonely Hawaiian girl and the fugitive alien who helps to mend her broken family. Directed by Dean Fleischer Camp, the Oscar®-nominated filmmaker behind the animated feature film “Marcel the Shell with Shoes On,” the film stars Sydney Elizebeth Agudong, Billy Magnussen, Tia Carrere, Hannah Waddingham, Chris Sanders, with Courtney B. Vance, and Zach Galifianakis, introducing Maia Kealoha. “Lilo & Stitch” is produced by Jonathan Eirich, p.g.a. and Dan Lin, with Louie Provost, Tom Peitzman and Ryan Halprin serving as executive producers.

2025-06-08.title: The Salt Path
2025-06-08.synopsis: THE SALT PATH is the profound true story of husband and wife, Raynor and Moth Winn’s 630-mile trek along the beautiful but rugged Cornish, Devon and Dorset coastline. After being forcibly removed from their home, they make the desperate decision to walk in the hope that, in nature, they will find solace and a sense of acceptance. With depleted resources, only a tent and some essentials between them, every step along the path is a testament to their growing strength and determination. THE SALT PATH is a journey that is exhilarating, challenging, and liberating in equal measure. A portrayal of home, how it can be lost and rediscovered in the most unexpected ways.

2025-06-08.title: Ocean With David Attenborough
2025-06-08.synopsis:
OCEAN WITH DAVID ATTENBOROUGH takes viewers on a breathtaking journey showing there is nowhere more vital for our survival, more full of life, wonder, or surprise, than the ocean.

The celebrated broadcaster and filmmaker reveals how his lifetime has coincided with the great age of ocean discovery. Through spectacular sequences featuring coral reefs, kelp forests and the open ocean, Attenborough shares why a healthy ocean keeps the entire planet stable and flourishing.

Stunning, immersive cinematography showcases the wonder of life under the seas and exposes the realities and challenges facing our ocean as never-before-seen, from destructive fishing techniques to mass coral reef bleaching. Yet the story is one of optimism, with Attenborough pointing to inspirational stories from around the world to deliver his greatest message: the ocean can recover to a glory beyond anything anyone alive has ever seen.

Screening in cinemas with theatrically exclusive footage.

2025-06-08.title: Film Club: A Single Man
2025-06-08.synopsis: An English professor, one year after the sudden death of his boyfriend, is unable to cope with his typical days in 1960s Los Angeles.

2025-06-08.title: Dangerous Animals
2025-06-08.synopsis: When Zephyr, a savvy and free-spirited surfer, is abducted by a shark-obsessed serial killer and held captive on his boat, she must figure out how to escape before he carries out a ritualistic feeding to the sharks below.

2025-06-08.title: Hallow Road
2025-06-08.synopsis: Two parents receive a distressing late-night call from their teenage daughter, who has just accidentally hit a pedestrian. They jump in their car, racing to get there before anyone else stumbles across the scene. As they head deeper into the night, disturbing revelations threaten to tear the family apart as they soon realise they might not be the only ones driving down Hallow Road.

2025-06-08.title: Parthenope
2025-06-08.synopsis: From Academy Award-winning fi lmmaker Paolo Sorrentino comes a monumental and deeply romantic story of a lifetime. Born in the Bay of Naples in 1950, Parthenope (Celeste Dalla Porta) searches for happiness over the long summers of her youth, falling in love with her home city and its many memorable characters. But when tragedy strikes, and carefree romances lose their thrill, she decides to seek a deeper sense of purpose. Featuring a captivating performance from Dalla Porta and an outstanding cast that includes Gary Oldman, PARTHENOPE is another tale of great beauty from a master of modern cinema.

2025-06-08.title: DocHouse: Burden of Dreams
2025-06-08.synopsis:
For five years, Werner Herzog desperately tried to complete FITZCARRALDO, despite every possible setback, an evermore unhinged Klaus Kinski and his own diehard insistence on hauling a steamship over a mountain. 

Luckily, Les Blank captured it all in this riveting account of the whole crazed process, from losing cast members (Jason Robards Jr., Mick Jagger), to a prop ship trapped in rapids, and Herzog haranguing hundreds of indigenous people to pull the 320-ton steamship up a muddy mountain. Anchored by an as-it-was-happening interview with Herzog himself, BURDEN OF DREAMS is a wild insight into his unflinching vision and the lengths he would go to to realise it.

2025-06-08.title: Motel Destino
2025-06-08.synopsis: The unexpected arrival of 21-year-old Heraldo, on the run after a botched hit, disrupts the established order at Motel Destino, a roadside sex hotel steaming under the burning blue skies of Brazil, run by hot-headed Elias and his restless younger wife Dayana.

2025-06-08.title: DocHouse: Wind, Tide & Oar
2025-06-08.synopsis:
Shot on analogue film over three years, WIND, TIDE & OAR explores engineless sailing, through the experiences of those who travel solely by harnessing the natural elements. Director Hugh Wahl offers a poetic and intimate perspective on a millennia-old craft, following an array of traditional boats and uncovering the unique rhythms and motivations of engineless navigations.

Journeying through rivers, coastlines, and open seas, WIND, TIDE & OAR creates a contemplative space, addressing themes of ecology, heritage, traditional skills, and maritime history.

Through the film’s reveries, sailing becomes a means to explore our interaction with and responsibility to the environment. It invites deep reflection on our relationship with nature, our understanding of and commitment to sustainability, and our care for the world around us.

2025-06-08.title: DocHouse: The Encampments
2025-06-08.synopsis:
The student protests that ignited at Columbia University in April 2024 made waves around the world. As the institution tried to shut down the Gaza Solidarity Encampment by force, the student movement grew, sparking encampments at hundreds of other campuses across the US.

2025-06-08.title: DocHouse: The Last Republican
2025-06-08.synopsis:
US Congressman Adam Kinzinger was the first Republican to hold Donald Trump accountable for the Jan 6th attack on the Capital, jeopardising his career and drawing vitriol from his own party in the process.  

A champion of conservative values, Kinzinger became an ardent critic of Trump, voting for his impeachment, though it cost him colleagues, friends and family. Hollywood director and comedian Steve Pink - himself a far left progressive - profiles Kinzinger during his last year in Congress as he, seemingly alone amongst Republicans, takes a stand. 

While Pink persistently challenges Kinzinger on his political views, he forms a surprisingly humourous friendship with his conservative Christian counterpart.

From three-time Oscar® nominee and Golden Globe winner Dean DeBlois, the creative visionary behind DreamWorks Animation’s acclaimed How to Train Your Dragon trilogy, comes a stunning live-action reimagining of the film that launched the beloved franchise.

Together, they must navigate the delicate path toward peace, soaring beyond the boundaries of their worlds and redefining what it means to be a hero and a leader.
